title: Find the cruise to suit your holiday budget
text:
Find the cruise to suit your holiday budget 13th Jul 2015 12:00 AM Photo courtesy of Flight Centre Related Items Local Real Estate Cars For Sale 
So, you've decided to set sail on your holiday, but which cruise is for you? Do you want to experience luxury on the high seas, or get more bang for your buck on a budget cruise? 
Cruising offers itineraries for many travel styles and budgets, ranging from the opulence and intimacy of a river cruise to combining affordability with fun on a budget liner. Photo courtesy of Flight Centre 
On a budget 
Cruising is ideal for families on a budget, and there are plenty of options to suit all travel styles and needs. 
For an all-inclusive holiday to the South Pacific, where all you need to do is drop your bags off in your cabin and enjoy the journey, amenities and destination, cruising is for you. On shore days, there is the option to enjoy the beautiful beaches of New Caledonia and Vanuatu or opt for paid shore excursions. 
Sailing from Brisbane, P&O Cruises venture to the South Pacific on itineraries from seven nights at sea. With a vast array of included meals, there is no need to spend extra money on breakfast, lunch or dinner, plus there are plenty of onboard amenities and facilities open to cruisers of all ages. If you are travelling with children, the onboard kids' and teenage centres offer supervised daily activities so the adults can nab some quality time as well. 
Carnival Cruise Lines is another great option for those cruising on a budget. Departing Sydney, the extensive Carnival fleet offers great deals for families with an award-winning youth program, and amenities everyone will enjoy, including the tallest waterslide at sea - no surprise that this cruise line is dubbed the 'Fun Ships'. There is also nightly entertainment, onboard casinos and plenty of pools to enjoy. If you are travelling with two or more children or as an extended family, ask about interconnecting rooms to keep the clan together. Photo courtesy of Flight Centre 
For the luxury lover 
Those who appreciate a first-class travel experience will adore cruising on a luxury liner. Whether you opt for an intimate river cruise, or a mid-size cruise line with elegant surrounds, impeccable service and superior amenities, there are myriad choices depending on your preferred cruise line and itinerary. 
For an all-inclusive European or US experience where all your onboard dining, drink and alcohol requirements, as well as shore excursions, are part of the upfront price, Crystal Cruises delivers. Guests will enjoy premium accommodations, luxury amenities, gourmet dining and a carefully curated array of enrichment programs and activities including language and dance classes, along with impeccable service. Some of the perks available to Crystal Cruises passengers include Evian spritzes by the pool, golf clinics, concierges and multi-course in-suite dining. 
For the cruising gourmand, look no further than Oceania Cruises . Best described as a fine country club at sea, Oceania is the world's only upper-premium cruise line and offers fine dining experiences onboard as well as inviting guests to accompany its world-renowned chefs to hand select local cuisine while at port. Coupled with more port-intensive itineraries and overnight stays in 300 ports worldwide, as well as a high staff-to-guest ratio and award-winning shore excursions, to enhance your experience, this is truly luxury cruising at its best. Photo courtesy of Flight Centre 
Something in between? 
For a change of pace and great all rounder for the above, the ever-popular Princess Cruises combines big ship amenities with the ambiance of a smaller vessel thanks to thoughtfully developed public areas that are tastefully decorated. Their longer voyages tend to attract an older crowd but they are still popular with families and couples. Princess Cruises span the globe since they set sail in the 70s and itineraries range in Africa, Asia, India, Alaska, Australia, Canada, New Zealand, The Americas, Australia and South Pacific. 
Royal Caribbean International is renowned for innovation in cruise and will also be bringing the new Ovations of the Seas to our shores with departures from Sydney. Ovations of Seas game-changing features include an observation capsule 90 metres above sea level with 360 degree views, the largest indoor active space including circus school and bumper cars and robotic cocktail drink mixers. Or set sail through the South Pacific in style aboard Royal Caribbean International's Legends of the Seas. This world-class ship will call Brisbane home and provides guests with an unforgettable experience with 'wow' facilities such as a central atrium with an acrobatic aerial show, rock climbing wall, mini golf course and indoor swimming pool! 
Cruising is all about choices, so how much you spend is really up to you. To make your holiday dollars travel further, look out for cruise sales throughout the year. Book during a sale period to save even more, select the cheapest room category and choose onboard activities that appeal to you. 
If you want to be pampered on and off the ship, book with a luxury cruise company where all the details are taken care of. Luxury cruises are ideal for gourmands keen on fine dining and personalised experiences, as well as those seeking cultural enrichment and luxury spa amenities and beauty treatments.
